alert.note: Alert for Upper Wind River Basin; Wind River Basin; Wind River Mountains East (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Fremont County through 930 PM MDT... At 858 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bull Lake, which is also 12 miles northwest of Fort Washakie, moving north at 20 mph. Additional showers and thunderstorms are tracking north-northwest along the east slope of the Wind River Range. HAZARD...Heavy rain, pea sized hail, and wind gusts around 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...The rain will cause ponding of water on roadways and make for muddy backcountry and secondary roads. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Bull Lake and Diversion Dam Rest Area around 910 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Crowheart and US 20/26. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: A quick 0.25 inches to 0.50 inches of rain is occurring with these showers and storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. If on or near Bull Lake, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.

area.areaDesc: Upper Wind River Basin; Wind River Basin; Wind River Mountains East
